Package no.ntnu.idatt1001.util.item

Class Item

java.lang.Object
no.ntnu.idatt1001.util.item.Item
public class Item extends Object
A class representing an item stored inside the warehouse. An item contains information accessed by the warehouse for simple warehouse functionality
Version:
1.1.0
Author:
10124

  • Constructor Details

    • Item

      protected Item(String itemNumber, String description, String brandName, int price, int warehouseStock, double weight, double length, double height, Color color, Category category)
      Constructor for the Item class. Used for creating an object instance of this class. This constructor can only be accessed by the ItemBuilder class. Please use the ItemBuilder class for specifying the parameters and use the ItemBuilder.build() method for creating an Item object.
      Parameters:
      itemNumber - The item number of the item, contatins both numbers and letters
      description - A text which describes the item
      brandName - A text containing the brand which the item was created by
      price - Integer representing the price of the item
      warehouseStock - Integer representing how many of this item is left in the warehouse
      weight - The weight of the item
      length - The length of the item
      height - The height of the item
      color - The color of the item
      category - Which warehouse category the item belongs to
      Throws:
      IllegalNumberException - If the specified price is below 0. Also throws if weight, length or height is 0 or below 0.
      NullPointerException - If the specified itemNumber, color or category is null

    • Item

      protected Item(Item item)
      Constructor for creating a deep copy of an Item object. The constructor takes an item as a parameter, and assigns the value of each field to this object's fields.
      Parameters:
      item - The Item which should be copied from
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the specified item is null

      Returns:
      The brand name of this item

    • getPrice

      public int getPrice()
      Gets the price of the item after calculation. The calculation takes into account the discount value. The price is calculated by taking the discount value, dividing it by 100, subtracting 1 from the result, and multiplying the result with the price value.
      Returns:
      The price of the item calculated with the discount

    • getDiscount

      public double getDiscount()
      Gets the discount of this item.
      Returns:
      The discount of this item

    • setPrice

      public void setPrice(int price)
      Sets the price of the item to the specified integer.
      Parameters:
      price - The price which the item should be set to
      Throws:
      IllegalNumberException - If the price specified is negative

    • setDiscount

      public void setDiscount(double discount)
      Sets the discount of the item. The discount is taken into account when the getPrice() method is called.
      Parameters:
      discount - The amount of discount specified in a percentage between 0 and 100
      Throws:
      IllegalNumberException - If the specified discount amount is below 0 or above 100

    • setWarehouseStock

      public void setWarehouseStock(int warehouseStock)
      Sets the warehouseStock of the item to the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      warehouseStock - The amount representing the number of items in stock
      Throws:
      IllegalNumberException - If the specified amount is below 0

      A standard to-string method with all the relevant information from this item in a specific format.
